context: Major League Baseball is especially well known for red teams. <b5_0>The Cincinnati Red Stockings<b5_0/> are th<b6_0>e oldest professional baseball team<b6_0/>, dating back to <a0_0>1869<a0_0/>. The franchise soon relocated to <a4_0><b7_0>Boston<b7_0/><a4_0/> and is now <a1_0>the Atlanta Braves<a1_0/>, but its name survives as the origin for both the Cincinnati Reds and Boston Red Sox. During the <b8_0>1950s<b8_0/> when red was strongly associated with <a2_0>communism<a2_0/>, the modern Cincinnati team was known as the "<a3_0>Redlegs<a3_0/>" and the term was used on baseball cards. After the red scare faded, the team was known as the "Reds" again.
